subtitle: These are some of the technologies and tools I have already had contact with.
hover_text: Hover over the icons to learn more

tech_descriptions.Css: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a style sheet language used to describe the presentation of HTML or XML documents. It defines how elements are displayed on screen, paper, or other media.
tech_descriptions.Html: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard language for creating web pages. It allows structuring the content of a page with elements such as headings, paragraphs, links, images, and more.
tech_descriptions.Javascript: JavaScript is a widely used programming language for creating dynamic and interactive content on the web. It allows manipulation of HTML and CSS elements, as well as communication with web servers.
tech_descriptions.Jest: Jest is a JavaScript testing framework developed by Facebook. It is widely used to test React applications and other JavaScript libraries, offering features such as mocks, asynchronous testing, and snapshots.
tech_descriptions.MaterialUI: Material-UI is a React component library that implements Google's Material Design guidelines. It provides a wide range of styled and customizable components to accelerate the development of user interfaces.
tech_descriptions.Next: Next.js is a React framework that allows the creation of web applications in a simple and efficient manner. It offers features like server-side rendering, static generation, and dynamic routing.
tech_descriptions.React: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, developed by Facebook. It facilitates the creation of reusable components and the management of application state.
tech_descriptions.ReactNavigation: React Navigation is a library for routing and navigation in React Native applications. It enables smooth and intuitive navigation in mobile applications, with support for stacks, tabs, and drawers.
tech_descriptions.Redux: Redux is a library for state management in JavaScript applications. It is often used with React to facilitate centralized and predictable management of the application's global state.
tech_descriptions.Sass: Sass (Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets) is a CSS extension that adds advanced features such as variables, nesting, mixins, and inheritance, making style development more powerful and organized.
tech_descriptions.Storybook: Storybook is a development tool that allows building and testing UI components in isolation. It is widely used for developing React components and creating reusable component libraries.
tech_descriptions.Tailwind: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that allows rapid development of user interfaces. It provides pre-defined classes to style elements without the need for writing custom CSS.
tech_descriptions.Typescript: TypeScript is a programming language that extends JavaScript by adding static typing. It helps prevent runtime errors and facilitates maintenance of large codebases.
tech_descriptions.Java: Java is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language widely used for developing enterprise applications, mobile applications, and embedded systems.
tech_descriptions.MySQL: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system. It is widely used for storing and managing data in web and enterprise applications.
tech_descriptions.Php: PHP is a widely used scripting language for web development. It is particularly suitable for creating dynamic and interactive web pages.
tech_descriptions.Postgresql: PostgreSQL is an advanced open-source relational database management system. It offers robustness and advanced features for storing and retrieving data.
tech_descriptions.Python: Python is a high-level programming language known for its simplicity and readability. It is widely used in web development, data science, artificial intelligence, and automation.
tech_descriptions.Filezilla: FileZilla is an open-source FTP client used to transfer files between a local computer and a remote server. It supports FTP, FTPS, and SFTP.
tech_descriptions.Git: Git is a distributed version control system widely used to track changes in code files and coordinate the work of multiple people on software projects.
tech_descriptions.Github: GitHub is a code hosting platform that uses Git for version control. It enables collaboration on software projects, code review, and management of issues and pull requests.
tech_descriptions.Gitlab: GitLab is a DevOps platform that provides Git repositories, CI/CD, project management, and collaboration tools. It is designed to facilitate the entire software development lifecycle.
tech_descriptions.Markdown: Markdown is a lightweight markup language used to format text in a simple and readable way. It is widely used in documentation, blogs, and forums.
tech_descriptions.Npm: NPM (Node Package Manager) is the default package manager for the Node.js environment. It allows installing, sharing, and managing dependencies of JavaScript projects.
tech_descriptions.OhMyZsh: Oh My Zsh is an open-source framework for managing Zsh shell configuration. It includes a collection of plugins and themes that enhance terminal usability.
tech_descriptions.SonarQube: SonarQube is an open-source platform for continuous inspection of code quality. It detects bugs, vulnerabilities, and provides insights to improve software maintenance.
tech_descriptions.Ubuntu: Ubuntu is a Debian-based Linux distribution. It is widely used on servers, desktops, and in software development for its stability and security.
tech_descriptions.Vercel: Vercel is a hosting and deployment platform for frontend projects. It is optimized for React, Next.js applications and offers features like continuous deployment and integrated CDN.
tech_descriptions.Yarn: Yarn is a package manager for JavaScript projects. It is an alternative to NPM, focused on speed, security, and consistency in managing dependencies.
tech_descriptions.Canva: Canva is a graphic design platform that allows users to create graphics, presentations, posters, and other visual content in a simple and intuitive way. It offers a wide range of templates and editing tools.
tech_descriptions.Figma: Figma is a collaborative web-based interface design tool. It allows creating interactive prototypes and real-time teamwork, facilitating the digital product design process.
